item.title: Dunsmure Rd Needs Cleaning, 12th July
item.description:
Litter up and down the street, along with random bags of garden waste and cardboard boxes left on corners. Gutters of street lined with rubbish and dead leaves everywhere. Can Hackney please clean and clean weekly. Litter and fly tipping is a constant.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Destroying trees, 12th July
item.description:
This lorry has been parking on Ravensdale Road N16 6TJ opposite 61, 59, and 57 for quite some time. Because of its height it is damaging newly planted and existing trees. It has knocked off a few branches. The driver couldn't care less.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ravensdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge obstructing the pavement, almost impossible to walk past especially for elderly., 12th July
item.description:
Overgrown hedge, growing out into the pavement walkway. With the street tree also next to the hedge, it’s almost impossible to walk past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Second Avenue, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Same scummy people emptying there cars here., 12th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsworth Close, Elmers End, London

item.title: Ongoing flytipping by residents, 12th July
item.description:
I would like to report constant flytipping by the residents of Woodhill road. This is effecting safety of children attending Woodhill School and increasing problems with the rat's in the area.Please help.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Woodhill, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: From 30 Englands Lane to 50 Englads lane, 12th July
item.description:
Payment on Belsize Park Gardens has been re-installed in H1 2025 however payment on England's lane is much worse than Belsize Park Gardens. Especially, as the pictures shows, pavement is covered by patch works after roadworks not blocks. I have been living on this road for last 5 years. During my residence, there was no improvement on pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44-46, England's Lane, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: NEW Black bags dumped in Mayplace Lane today, 12th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Lane, Shooters Hill, London
